snippet.title: Kids Fitness - Star Wars Baby Yoda  - Brain Break Toddler Learning
snippet.description:
Star Wars fans! We created a special Star Wars kids show for your toddlers and kids about your favorite Star Wars characters and places. Move like C3PO, blast off like the Millennium Falcon, dodge the asteroids, yoga pose like #babyyoda and enjoy a fun skit with RoboDad as Kylo Ren training you from the Dark Side. If your children like to move and jump or if they already do kids yoga, they will love RoboTots fitness adventures. 

Learn coordination, balance and build your child’s confidence. Watch your children get better each time they complete new moves. If your kids are shy in group classes, start with RoboTots. This is a great way to have fun and develop skills right in your own home. Kids can be silly and jump around without the added pressure of other kids in the class or a new environment. 

15 fun and easy moves for your little kids who love Disney and Star Wars! This fun Star Wars workout will get your kids jumping and dancing. Watch the timer- Kids love to earn stars and diamonds as they complete each exercise move for 15 seconds. Lots of fun music and graphics for kids to see. 

RoboTots creates Family Friendly Content for parents and educators. Kids can enjoy these fun videos while learning the importance of being active at a young age.

Your kids can have fun with these simple exercise moves. Great ideas for brain breaks at school and indoor activities for home or the classroom.

FITNESS for Kids
:35 X-Wing Fighter Jumping Jacks
1:00 Chewbacca Lunges
1:30 C3PO robot dance
2:01 R2D2 Move
2:36 AT-AT walk
3:05 Storm Trooper March
3:35 Kylo Ren 
4:45 Halftime RoboTots Team
5:10 Millennium Falcon Jump
5:40 Dodge the Asteroids
6:22 Tie Fighter flying
6:47 Frozen in Carbonite
7:10 Death Star twist
7:41 Jedi Training Use the Force
8:08 Star Wars Cantina Dance
8:32 Baby Yoda Meditation

9:38 LEARNING ADVENTURE
After the RoboTots kids Star Wars workout, blast off to Star Wars Land for a kids educational tour of Galaxy's Edge in Disneyland. The city of Batuu at Galaxys edge is so realistic. There are storm troopers, scoundrels and Jedi roaming around, so we must be very careful. The Star Wars learning adventure starts with the Millennium Falcon and we learn to count to 12 parsecs. Our preschool age son is a big Star Wars fan. First we took him on the Millennium Falcon ride at Disneyland Galaxys Edge. Next we found the Droid Depot at Star Wars land and learned how to build our very own droid. R-series or BB unit. We chose the R series like R2-D2. Learn about colors, pick your favorite parts and put it together. The activated droid communicates with other droids in Disneyland Star Wars land. Next we see a sign in a foreign language. We learn about Aurebesh the mythical language of Star Wars. We check out the milk stand. Have you ever tried blue or green milk? Watch how RoboDad drinks the milk. We had so much fun showing you around Disneyland Galaxy Edge for kids! We hope you enjoyed the educational adventure. May the force be with you!

10:21 Counting to 12 parsecs
10:50 Millennium Falcon Ride at Star Wars land
11:44 Building a droid at the Droid Depot
13:26 Aurebesh Language of Star Wars
13:54 Blue and Green Milk - Milk Stand Galaxy's Edge

Please join our Instagram and Facebook page to connect with us and share your experiences. We want to see photos/video of your kids doing the exercises. Use #robotots for a feature on the @robotots Instagram.

Don’t forget to SUBSCRIBE!
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCINWamNPjQkTKz78hZM7tiQ?sub_confirmation=1

Kids EXERCISE Video Playlist
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLZ0EeFHqhnC4_R0STQ41MCxiwiL9hHC6Q

RoboTots Family Vlog Playlist
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLZ0EeFHqhnC6TUNapqmj6oexUVg7sbSb5

Hi there! New to RoboTots? If so, here's what you need to know -- We like kids activities a LOT, so we use this channel to explore kids exercise, toddler activities, and family vacations with kids, to inspire you to live an active family life.

Join our growing RoboTots community today! Find us on Instagram.

Please contact robototsmom@gmail.com

Get your scholars moving to the "Get Loose" brain break song! Inspiring students to have fun while learning by taking a break to get loose for some educational fun! snippet.title: Brain Break: Stretching
snippet.description:
Join the Strong4Life Challenge Team as they lead a stretching brain break activity that you can do anywhere.

Learning is important, but it's difficult to learn something new when we're tired or low on energy. Encourage your child(ren) to recharge their brain and body by taking regular breaks throughout the school day to do something active. Not only are brain breaks fun, but they make it easier to focus and learn.

And remember to help keep yourself and others safe by practicing the 3 W's: wear a mask, wash your hands and watch your distance.

snippet.title: Listen to my Heart | Dance with Me | Songs for Kids | Brain Breaks

Listen to my Heart is a fun song teaching children about our beating heart and the positive impact exercise has on our health.

Where fun learning never stops!
www.cheekymonkeyclub.com.au

What happens when we walk, run, dance, jump and lie down? Let' s get those hearts pumping while we sing and dance. For babies, toddlers, preschool and kindergarten kids who are exploring singing, dancing and rhythm and exercise.

snippet.title: Kids Yoga #2, Online Resources, Physical Education, DPA, Brain Breaks, Exercise, Health, Wellness
snippet.description:
Get the Flash-Cards Here!! https://www.teacherspayteachers.com/Product/Yoga-Flash-Cards-Physical-Literacy-PE-5905923

Take a break with your students and practice Yoga with this easy to follow video!!
(9 Mins)

During this video, students are expected to follow the yoga poses that are shown on the screen. Each movement activity will last for 40 seconds before changing. The music in the video will motivate and inspire your students.

Health and physical education offers students a unique opportunity for kinesthetic learning – they learn about healthy, active living primarily by “doing”, that is, through physical activity. In health and physical education, students discover the joy of movement, learn about their bodies, and develop physical and cognitive skills that will contribute to their lifelong health and well-being.

https://www.teacherspayteachers.com/Product/Kids-Yoga-2-Online-Resources-Physical-Education-DPA-Brain-Breaks-5932578

snippet.title: If a Kangaroo Can Jump | Kids Song |Music and Movement | Brain Break
snippet.description:
Join Mimi, Gabi-Roo and friends for this music and movement song that teaches kids that they can try and do new things. A great song for a brain break in the classroom or at home. 

Song Lyrics

If a kangaroo can jump then you can too

Verse 1

Follow me along
See if you can do
All the sounds and movements 
That you might see in a zoo
You might be surprised
At how easy it can be
To imitate the animals
In this menagerie


Chorus

Soar as high as an eagle
Squawk like an Aussie cockatoo
Hang out like a sloth
Or waddle like a duck
If a kangaroo can jump then you can too


Verse 2

It’s not very hard
To copy what you see
To hop and stomp and crawl or swim 
Like creatures in the sea
Or talk to the animals
With a ‘woof’ or ‘quack’ or ‘moo’
Or growl and roar at dinner time
Like lions in the zoo

Chorus

Swing and scratch like a monkey
Snort and prance like gnu
Gallop like a zebra
Or slink like a fox
If a kangaroo can jump then you can too

If a kangaroo can jump then you can too!

localized.title: If a Kangaroo Can Jump | Kids Song |Music and Movement | Brain Break
localized.description:
Join Mimi, Gabi-Roo and friends for this music and movement song that teaches kids that they can try and do new things. A great song for a brain break in the classroom or at home. 

Song Lyrics

If a kangaroo can jump then you can too

Verse 1

Follow me along
See if you can do
All the sounds and movements 
That you might see in a zoo
You might be surprised
At how easy it can be
To imitate the animals
In this menagerie


Chorus

Soar as high as an eagle
Squawk like an Aussie cockatoo
Hang out like a sloth
Or waddle like a duck
If a kangaroo can jump then you can too


Verse 2

It’s not very hard
To copy what you see
To hop and stomp and crawl or swim 
Like creatures in the sea
Or talk to the animals
With a ‘woof’ or ‘quack’ or ‘moo’
Or growl and roar at dinner time
Like lions in the zoo

Chorus

Swing and scratch like a monkey
Snort and prance like gnu
Gallop like a zebra
Or slink like a fox
If a kangaroo can jump then you can too

If a kangaroo can jump then you can too!

snippet.title: Yoga for Kids: Brain Break 1: standing poses
snippet.description:
In this yoga video can be used as a brain break in your classroom or during remote learning. The poses featured in this video are standing poses that kids can do in the class standing in front of their chair or at home standing in front of their learning device. 

Brain breaks are important during learning because kids needs to move their bodies in order to stay focused on their learning.

snippet.title: Mindful Activity for Kids | Fun Mindfulness | Brain Break for Children
snippet.description:
This video helps kids learn how to release physical and emotional tension. We play a game where they make their bodies really tight, squeezing all of their muscles and then relax all of their muscles as much as possible. Games like this help to regulate kids' emotions through mindfulness exercises.  Follow along here on our guided mindfulness activity and you'll start learning a lifelong habit that has tremendous health benefits. Did you know that meditating for at least 10 mins a day helps achieve a happier mindset? Remember that learning any skill takes practice. Try to do at least one mindfulness exercise each day. 

Try another mindfulness activity:
https://youtu.be/lnAx_Dr_CfA

Want to get some exercise? Try a fun cardio and strength routine:
https://youtu.be/oj-iqwuHCHM

Ready to have some fun? Dance it out with Bond! 
https://youtu.be/FOwN3MLP3Yc

snippet.title: Good Morning Song | Morning Call and Response for Kids | Circle Time | Brain Breaks for Children
snippet.description:
This Good Morning Song is a fun, interactive video to help pre K-grade 5 students energized & ready to start their day.  I had so much fun creating this fun, good morning/welcome song to help kids learn! And a bonus...it’s also a great call and response song.

Let me know what you and your students think!

Speaking of good morning songs, what songs or routines do you do in the morning to get ready for learning? Any creative ideas? Any early thoughts about how you’ll celebrate in this virtual environment?

**I wrote the lyrics and produced the music for this video. For those of you I haven’t yet had the pleasure of meeting, I’m a K-5 early childhood education teacher with a passion for educating children and using the power of music to help children learn and excel.

I publish new videos every week, so be sure to like and SUBSCRIBE to my YouTube channel for more fun videos to help your K-5 students/kids learn.

#goodmorningsong #welcomesongsforchildren #brainbreaksforkids

snippet.description:

GoNoodle gets kids moving to be their strongest, bravest, silliest, smartest, bestest selves. Over 14 million kids each month are dancing, stretching, running, jumping, deep breathing, and wiggling with GoNoodle at GoNoodle.com --  https://goo.gl/fA6qK3


LYRICS:
I’ve got the feeling that today is a special day and we need to CELEBRATE!

Now it’s time to celebrate, to celebrate
Now it’s time to celebrate, to celebrate

Y’all, that is so great, let's not wait let's celebrate
Undulate, move your vertebrate
Party activate! Be a good time advocate!
Move your body as we celebrate and...
Animate, congregate, culminate, demonstrate
Dance on down to the Bering Strait
But there’s one thing left to extrapolate
so come on party people let me hear you say it!

WHAT ARE WE CELEBRATING?
(shout it out loud)
WHAT ARE WE CELEBRATING?

(That’s right!)
Now it’s time to celebrate, to celebrate
(Woo, it feels good to celebrate!)
Now it’s time to celebrate, to celebrate

Don't premeditate or procrastinate, 
Let's appreciate, let's celebrate
Undulate, move your vertebrates
Strut the runway like a fashion plate

Let’s see…
Navigate, percolate, propagate, save the date,
Syncopate, tabulate, tolerate, celebrate!

Educate, elevate, instigate, motivate, 
Today’s the date to celebrate, it feels so great to ask y’all…
WHAT ARE WE CELEBRATING?
(shout it out loud)
WHAT ARE WE CELEBRATING?

Go Class! Go Class! Go Class! 
Go Class! Go Class! Go Class! 

Oh yeah! You are celebrating with Blazer Fresh! Get up out of your seats and dance with us! Celebrate! Celebrate! Celebrate!

WHAT ARE WE CELEBRATING?
(shout it out loud)
WHAT ARE WE CELEBRATING?
WHAT ARE WE CELEBRATING?
(shout it out loud)
WHAT ARE WE CELEBRATING?

There’s so much to celebrate! Can’t stop me, baby!

How fast are you? Great kid, student and family workout fun. Great for a quick brain break for kids. Pe At Home challenge is to perform exercises at the correct number from 1 to 4.  Create a grid 4 x 4. If you have the space make the grid bigger for a added challenge or smaller for K-2 to make it less challenging.

snippet.title: Spelling for Kids - Mr. B's Brain - Ep. 5: Stretching, Breaking, and Sounding Out Words
snippet.description:
Spelling for Kids shows how to stretch and break words, and pick the proper vowel sound.

Other Mr. B's Brain Videos:
Subtraction Magic: https://youtu.be/96kDx-yw3f0
Phonics Reading: https://youtu.be/tpLKilWB3mw
Addition Gameshow: https://youtu.be/BIu3QBSn0ig
2D vs. 3D Shapes: https://youtu.be/YxoLlSTu1jo
Addition Song: https://youtu.be/v6cMscvg3TE

Please like, share, and subscribe!  
Follow us on Instagram: @mr._bs_brain
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/MrBs-Brain-978358632371933/
https://www.mrbsbrain.com/

Mr. B's Brain shows that sounding out words is systematic: stretch the word slowly, break it into its component chunks, listen closely for the vowel sound, and finally write what you hear.

For most children, some time around preschool, kindergarten, or first grade they start to see words not as whole units, but small chunks that come together to form words.   Sure worksheet practice is part of the process, but our video will bring another part to that: fun visuals and examples to help children see the pattern to spelling.  That way they will be ready for the spelling test!  We use fun, fancy clipart to bring together our electronic program.  It's for the beginner, early primary grade spellers, typically a 6 year old or under.  And remember, early spelling is not always about being correct, but listening for the acceptable sounds they hear (e.g. "bat" might be "bt" "bet" or even just "b").  The words you select should be a challenge level of medium without frustration, and practice throughout the week as you would any skill you want to improve.  If the child is having trouble hearing sounds in words, switch to a visual style as that might be a stronger way of processing for that particular kid.

Our goal at Mr. B's Brain is to use YouTube as an enrichment for school.  We aim to help each student with animated learning opportunities.  We have gotten feedback that our lessons are effective for the toddler all the way to the adult - as it helps moms and dads learn how to teach their students in better ways.  We've done a patient search of video Youtube content, surveyed teachers, looked at what was effective in the classroom, analyzed lesson plans, and then came to create what you see before you.  We are proud of our free high resolution short videos that are a great tool to join with a traditional education.  You have our permission to use them in your home, preschool, kindergarten class, first grade classroom, or anywhere else you'd like to.  Thanks for your support, enjoy!

I am an animal,
you are an animal,
We are all animals,
Let's have some fun!

Stomp like an elephant. Stomp! Stomp! Stomp!
Stomp like an elephant. Stomp! Stomp! Stomp!
Stomp your feet, to the beat. Stomp! Stomp! Stomp!
Stomp! Stomp! Stomp!
Stomping is fun!

I am an animal,
you are an animal,

Let's have some fun!

Swing your arms like a monkey. Swing! Swing! Swing!

Swing your arms, swing them well
Swings your arms and yell! Oo-oo-oo!
Swing! Swing! Swing!
Swinging is fun.

I am an animal,
you are an animal,
We are all animals,
Let's have some fun!

Run around like a cheetah. Run! Run! Run!
Run around like a cheetah. Run! Run! Run!
Run around, really fast! Watch out! Don't be last! 
Run! Run! Run!
Running is fun

I am an animal,
you are an animal,
We are all animals,
Let's have some fun!

Fly like a bird. Fly! Fly! Fly!
Fly like a bird. Fly! Fly! Fly!
Flap your wings so you can fly,
Fly up high, in the sky! 
Fly! Fly! Fly!
Flying is fun!

I am an animal,
you are an animal,
We are all animals,
Let's have some fun!

Walk like a penguin. Walk! Walk! Walk!
Walk like a penguin. Walk! Walk! Walk!
Walk very slowly, with your wings by your sides.
Walk! Walk! Walk! 
Walking is fun

I am an animal,
you are an animal,
We are all animals,
Let's have some fun!

Stomp! Stomp! Stomp!
Swing! Swing! Swing!
Run! Run! Run!
Fly! Fly! Fly!
Walk! Walk! Walk!

I am an animal,
you are an animal,
We are all animals,
Let's have some fun!

I am an animal,
you are an animal,
We are all animals,
Let's have some fun!

snippet.title: Monster Disco Dance Fitness, Exercise, Physical Education, PE, Brain Break, Active Kids, Movement
snippet.description:
Get your Fitness Tracker Here!! https://www.teacherspayteachers.com/Product/Exercise-Journal-Weekly-Fitness-Tracker-Physical-Literacy-5902877

Get your students moving with the Monster Disco Dance!!

3 Minutes

Health and physical education offers students a unique opportunity for kinesthetic learning – they learn about healthy, active living primarily by “doing”, that is, through physical activity. In health and physical education, students discover the joy of movement, learn about their bodies, and develop physical and cognitive skills that will contribute to their lifelong health and well-being.

snippet.title: Online Kids Class #49 ♫ Haunted House "LIVE" & Halloween Songs For Kids ♫ by The Learning Station
snippet.description:
Online Class #49: Welcome to The Learning Station online/virtual class #48 for children. Online Kids Class #48 will include: ♫ Music and movement and learning for preschoolers by The Learning Station (Also, known as Learning Station). Here is a list of the educational action, movement, brain breaks and fun learning Halloween songs we will be performing today: 
❤ Haunted House "LIVE" (Fun brain break adventure)
❤ Wild Things (Literacy tie-in, costumes and a brain break)
❤ Stirring Our Brew (Cute monsters performing this fun brain break)
❤ Five Little Pumpkins (Count to five Halloween song)

Visit our website where you can find all of these songs available on a CD or in single song downloads. https://www.learningstationmusic.com/shop/

Haunted House Halloween Songs for Kids: Your children will love our scary Halloween freeze dance for kids. Children explore a Halloween haunted house with a friendly dancing goblin, skeleton, werewolf and vampire.  This scary Halloween song is ideal for preschoolers, kindergarten & elementary children. Also, this Halloween dance song is perfect for school assemblies, family nights, children’s performances and kids Halloween parties. This is a fun freeze dance that children love!

♫ Haunted House  (Halloween song & freeze dance for children & kids)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     by The Learning Station
℗©Monopoli/The Learning Station
★ Lyrics
We tip toed through the haunted house and what did we see? 
A ghostly, ghoulish goblin waving cheerfully. 
He wiggled and he wobbled and he winked his eye
And then we started dancing much to our surprise.
We started mashing, toe tapping, we touched our toes and knees.
And then he growled RAAAW! And then he howled OOOOH. 
And he hopped and shouted FREEZE!
Tip toe, tip toe through the haunted house we go.
Tip toe, tip toe through the haunted house we go.

We tip toed through the haunted house and what did we see? 
A silly, spooky skeleton waving cheerfully. 
 He wiggled and he wobbled and he winked his eye
And then we started dancing much to our surprise.
We started mashing, toe tapping, we touched our toes and knees.
And then he growled RAAAW! And then he howled OOOOH. 
And he hopped and shouted FREEZE!
Tip toe, tip toe through the haunted house we go.
Tip toe, tip toe through the haunted house we go.

We tip toed through the haunted house and what did we see? 
A wild, wacky werewolf waving cheerfully. 
 He wiggled and he wobbled and he winked his eye
And then we started dancing much to our surprise.
We started mashing, toe tapping, we touched our toes and knees.
And then he growled RAAAW! And then he howled OOOOH. 
And he hopped and shouted FREEZE!
Tip toe, tip toe through the haunted house we go.
Tip toe, tip toe through the haunted house we go.

We tip toed through the haunted house and what did we see? 
A very vain vampire waving cheerfully. 
 He wiggled and he wobbled and he winked his eye
And then we started dancing much to our surprise.
We started mashing, toe tapping, we touched our toes and knees.
And then he growled RAAAW! And then he howled OOOOH. 
And he hopped and shouted FREEZE!
Tip toe, tip toe out of the haunted house we go.
Tip toe, tip toe out of the house we go.
Tip toe, tip toe out of the haunted house we go.
Tip toe, tip toe, make sure you close the door.
SOUND EFFECT- Door closing to a slam!

Take a 15 minute break from the books with these catchy fun tunes from The Juicebox Jukebox! You can find all of these songs and more on our brand new album "Now Hear This!" available everywhere July 31st. Get your copy on CD from our website at http://thejuiceboxjukebox.com/nowhearthis.html 

iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/us/artist/the-juicebox-jukebox/1419399836

Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/artist/5E97AmvYFM4aGWCOtJkzYH?si=5yrwErIsScW9PGHNx9J9FA

The Juicebox Jukebox was created by Dallas based singer/songwriter and father of three Bradley James Skistimas. Our mission is to enrich children’s lives through fun, positive, and educational music and videos that parents and teachers can enjoy, too. We focus our songs on core subjects and character building themes with a fresh perspective for students primarily in Pre-K through 2nd grade. 

Don’t forget to like and subscribe for updates!

snippet.title: Partner Brain Break: "Keep Your Head Up"
snippet.description:
Here's the moves we came up with to the "Keep Your Head Up" song by Andy Grammer. So grab a partner and let's get ready to breathe, connect, and rock this brain break!  ♥OPEN FOR MORE♥
____________________________

BACKSTORY: Tired of the traditional Brain Break songs available, my daughter Avery and I set out to create some fun new brain breaks to popular songs that not only get your body moving, but also serve as opportunities for connection and eye contact with peers and adults to help support healthy relationships. These work great as part of a Conscious Discipline "Brain Smart Start" in how they incorporate opportunities to 1- Unite (everyone doing the same actions) 2- Disengage Stress (deep breathing), 3- Connect (hugs and eye contact).  So enjoy the break and have fun connecting with those you love both at school and at home!
____________________________

Intersted in learning more about Conscious Discipline for your home or classroom, click here to learn more: https://consciousdiscipline.com

My Other Conscious Discipline video: "How to Connect with Kids Using I Love You Rituals": https://youtu.be/bl7b3TespAw

____________________________

OTHER PLACES YOU CAN FIND ME:

♥FOLLOW ME ON INSTAGRAM♥
ashleysgreenlife (https://instagram.com/ashleysgreenlife/)


♥SUBSCRIBE TO MY YOUTUBE CHANNEL♥
http://www.youtube.com/subscription_c...

Please leave friendly comments or questions below!
____________________________

Thank you for all your support 
❤Ashley

snippet.title: "Together Again" Fun Brain Break Song for Kids
snippet.description: Hello Everybody. Here is a great song to sing in the morning while students have a lot of energy. This song "Together Again" also shares the expectation of your class that students and teachers will sing and be happy because we're all here together again! I like to sing this song with an accelerando to help students get all of their silly energy out. After clapping, stomping, and patting, you can come up with any type of movement you would like to do. You can even allow students to come up with their own movement or pose. Use this time to help students stretch and gain focus while also acting silly. It is all about finding a balance!

snippet.title: Tooty Ta | Hip Hop Tooty Ta | Tooty Ta Hip Hop | Tooty Ta Song | Brain Breaks | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
Tooty Ta is super popular children’s song as part of your “brain breaks” for students to get some fun physical activity, and rejuvenate their body and brain. Children everywhere love Tooty ta!

Hip-Hop Tooty Ta can really help to re-focus student’s attention, get a mental and physical break from their academics  enabling them to have a better focus for learning.  Using my cool 
Hip-Hop Tooty-Ta as a “brain break” is a win-win situation. Students learn during these “brain breaks” plus return to a task renewed and energized.

Classroom and Physical Education teachers as well as home learners can quickly and easily use Tooty Ta to give students fun and energizing brain breaks.

snippet.title: Learning to Count | Counting By 100's | Brain Breaks | Kid's Songs | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
This super fun count by 100's song will really help your children learn how to count by 100's to 1,000.  The melody and rhythm are so catchy that the counting by 100's will simply stick in their brain, and they'll always remember.  Your children will sing along and they will want to dance along, too, to this upbeat, cool tune.  Counting by 100's to 1000 will be a self-esteem builder, too, because they will feel so good knowing they can count up so high.   Kids really have fun when they count big numbers like counting by 100 to 1000.   Teachers can extend this count by 100's to 1,000 skill by introducing the importance of the number zero.  You can discuss how the zeroes hold the place value for the tens, hundreds and thousands.  This song is so bright and upbeat your children will want to sing it all the time, and they'll really understand how to count by 100's all the way to 1,000.


LYRICS: 
 
Chorus (x1)                
I like to count big numbers,
I like to count by hundreds,
I like to count big numbers,
C’mon join me now, 
 
One hundred, two hundred, three hundred,
Four hundred, five hundred, six hundred,
Seven hundred, eight hundred, nine hundred,
One thousand!

Let's do it again!
 
(Repeat counting by hundreds)
 
Repeat Chorus and Counting
